plugins.name: 竹记 - 创意过程记录&实时预览
plugins.description:
1. To use Bamboo Record, you need to install both plug-ins and desktop software. The software can be installed through the official website https://zj.freshart.top/
  2. Please make sure that the plug-ins and software are always on during use;
  3. If you need to use other plug-ins, it is recommended to turn on the Bamboo Record plug-in again as soon as possible after use, otherwise it cannot be recorded;
  4. Bamboo Record will record each design change when running, which can be viewed randomly, and supports exporting the design process to video;
  5. It is better to determine the width and height of the drawing board before running the plug-in. It is not recommended to modify the width and height of the drawing board during the recording process;
  6. In addition, Bamboo Record provides a free real-time preview function that supports multi-device code scanning preview (to ensure that the computer and mobile terminals are on the same local area network and are allowed to pass through the firewall).


--------------


  1. 使用竹记需同时安装插件和桌面端软件，软件可通过官网安装（中文版） https://zj.94xy.com/
  2. 使用过程中请确保插件和软件一直处于开启状态；
  3. 如需使用其它插件，建议在使用之后，尽快再次开启竹记插件，否则无法记录；
  4. 竹记运行时会记录每一次设计变更，随机可以查看，支持将设计过程导出为视频：
  5. 在运行插件前就确定好画板宽高效果更佳，不建议在记录过程中修改画板宽高；
  6. 另外竹记提供了免费的实时预览功能，支持多设备扫码预览（使用需确保电脑端和移动端处于同一局域网，并允许通过防火墙）。
plugins.tagline: Record creative footprints and capture design moments

plugins.name: Auto Palette
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin for formula-driven, dynamic color extraction.


Auto Palette is a plugin that helps designers extract smart, context-aware color palettes directly from images using precise formulas — including average, dominant, and contrast-aware color models.


In a time when Material 3 is embracing expressive tones and iOS 19 leaks tease a UI shift toward progressive blur and dynamic visuals, Auto Palette gives you a reliable starting point to build your own adaptive, fluid color systems.


Coming soon:


Color variable mapping for component-level handoff

Design token export to streamline dev collaboration

Design with clarity. Build with logic. Hand off with confidence.
plugins.tagline: Build dynamic color pallete from images

135919.release_notes:

- Minor bug fixes
135919.tagline: Build dynamic color pallete from images

plugins.name: Style X-Ray
plugins.description:
Style X-Ray is your UI detective inside Figma. Instantly inspect layout, spacing, typography, colors, shadows, and more — all translated into CSS-friendly properties.


Perfect for developers using Tailwind, vanilla CSS, or AI tools like Cursor. Just select a frame, extract the design anatomy, and paste the JSON into your code workflow.


🚀 Speed up dev handoff

🔍 Catch spacing & style issues early

🤖 Power up AI agents with real design data
plugins.tagline: Scan Figma designs. Expose the CSS beneath.

129669.name: Style X-Ray
129669.description:
Style X-Ray is your UI detective inside Figma. Instantly inspect layout, spacing, typography, colors, shadows, and more — all translated into CSS-friendly properties.


Perfect for developers using Tailwind, vanilla CSS, or AI tools like Cursor. Just select a frame, extract the design anatomy, and paste the JSON into your code workflow.


🚀 Speed up dev handoff

🔍 Catch spacing & style issues early

🤖 Power up AI agents with real design data
129669.release_notes:
- Auto-Reveal on Open: CSS properties are now automatically revealed when you open the plugin, making it easier to get straight to the details.
- Improved Formatting: CSS property display has been reformatted for better readability and cleaner presentation.
- Search function to easily find the properties you're looking for
129669.tagline: Scan Figma designs. Expose the CSS beneath.

plugins.name: Tiiny Color Palette Generator
plugins.description:
Tiiny empowers you to generate natural color palettes with tints and shades in 12 stops, based on your chosen base color.


Key Features:

  1. Dynamic Palette Generation: Automatically generate a cohesive color palette with multiple shades and tints tailored to your base color, ensuring visual consistency across your project.
  2. Customizable Formats: Choose between RGB, HSL, and HSB color formats to suit your specific design needs and preferences.
  3. Accessibility Focused: Designed with accessibility in mind, ensuring that your color choices are both visually appealing and inclusive.


Transform your design process with the Tiiny Color Palette Generator and bring vibrant, cohesive colors to your projects with just a few clicks. Elevate your creativity and ensure consistency across all your design endeavors!
plugins.tagline: Create natural looking color palettes with 12 stops, for your designs.

plugins.name: FigJam Export to Markdown or JSON
plugins.description:
Turn sticky-note chaos into structured documentation.


This plugin reads your FigJam board, detects heading hierarchies by the number of ⭐ star stamps on each card, and exports a clean outline – perfect for journey-maps, service blueprints, research affinity walls or any workshop board that needs to become a report.


What you get

• Markdown or JSON with true heading levels (H1 / H2 / …).

• Bullet lists for every sticky-note or text card.

• Embedded screenshots and photos – automatically resized, placed under the right heading and zipped into an assets/ folder.

• One-click download; whole page or just the frames you select.


How it works

1 Structure top-down

Place headings above their content; the heading’s width defines the column below it.

2 Stamp to mark hierarchy

3 identical stars = H1, 2 stars = H2, 1 or 0 = regular content.

(Stars sitting on an image are ignored.)

3 Click “Download MD” or “Download JSON”

Text-only boards produce a single file; boards with images are delivered as a ready-to-share .zip.


Stop rebuilding journey maps slide-by-slide. Export once, drop the Markdown into Notion, Confluence or GitHub – or feed the JSON into your own reporting pipeline.
plugins.tagline: From FigJam to finished journey-map reports in one click – stamp, export, done.

plugins.name: Stroke Shortcuts
plugins.description:
A tool for quickly adjusting stroke settings of Figma objects.


Key features:

• Increase/decrease stroke weight (+1/-1)

• Cycle stroke position inside/outside

• Apply to multiple selected objects at once


Streamline your design workflow and make stroke adjustments with ease.


---


Figmaオブジェクトのストローク設定を素早く調整するプラグインです。


主な機能：

• ストロークの太さを増減（+1/-1）

• ストロークの位置を内側/外側に切り替え

• 選択したオブジェクトに一括適用可能


デザインワークフローを効率化し、ストローク調整を簡単に行えます。
plugins.tagline: Stroke Control: A shortcut plugin for quick stroke weight and position adjustments

plugins.name: Consistent contacts
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to create your own data structure (text or image) and than fill the data into your frames based on matching layer and key name. You have to have the data structure in a predefined JSON format. Example:

{

"records": [

{

"photo": { "image": "avatar-01.jpg" },

"name": "John Doe",

"id": "1234",

"phone": "+1 110-1234",

"company": "TechNova Inc.",

"position": "Software Engineer",

"email": "john.doe@technova.com"

}

]

}

The JSON can be ZIPped with images to a single file, which you can drop to the plugin and populate the frames. The populated frames have to be wrapped together in a parent frame or a component instance works as well. All the frames or instances have to be selected directly to be populated correctly.


WEBP image format is not supported by Figma. JPG and PNG formats works. The whole ZIP file has to be smaller than 1MB, which is a memory limit for any plugin. The ZIP file is remembered, even if you close the plugin, but it is removed from memory and replaced by a new one, if you select a new file.


Not being a developer myself, this is my very first attempt to create a Figma plugin with a huge help from AI. I was able to make it into a working prototype, but there might still be some glitches. If the plugin does not work correctly, check the ZIP content, JSON structure and correct naming of the images. If the plugin stops to work, try to "Clear memory" via a dedicated button. It should reset everything and clean the memory of the plugin.
plugins.tagline: Fill in consistent connected data to your frames

plugins.name: SelectLock
plugins.description:
💪🏽 Take control of your Figma layers with SelectLock!


SelectLock is your secret weapon for maintaining design integrity in Figma. This powerful plugin lets you lock multiple layers in one go while keeping specific layer types editable.


Here's what you can do:


  1. Bulk lock layers across your entire Figma file
  2. Cherry-pick which layer types stay unlocked
  3. Use a simple checkbox interface for layer selection
  4. Lock your design with just one click
  5. Keep your layer structure intact


Perfect for designers who want to secure their work without sacrificing flexibility. Whether you're polishing a final design or collaborating with a team, SelectLock helps you stay in control. Say goodbye to the tedious task of locking layers one by one. With SelectLock, you're the boss of your design file!


👉🏼 Click here to drop a feedback

👉🏼 Send me a mail


Thank you for using SelectLock.


👉🏼 How to Use


  1. Select the frame or group containing the layers you want to lock
  2. Run the Selectlock plugin from the Plugins menu
  3. In the plugin interface, check the boxes next to any layer types you want to lock/unlock
  4. Click the "Lock/Unlock" button
  5. All checked layer types will be locked/unlocked, while unchecked layer types remain editable/uneditable.
plugins.tagline: Lock specific layer types in bulk. Keep designing freely.

plugins.name: Fill Up
plugins.description:
Fill Up 플러그인이 드디어 오픈했습니다!


이제 리스트, 카드 UI, 데이터 그리드 등 다양한 디자인에 가상 데이터를 채우는 일을 더 이상 고민하지 마세요. Fill Up은 클릭 한 번으로 데이터를 랜덤하게 채워주어, 디자인 작업을 더욱 스마트하게 만들어 줍니다. 복잡한 데이터 입력은 저희에게 맡기고, 당신은 디자인에만 집중하세요!


현재는 한국어 텍스트 변환 기능에 우선 집중하고 있지만, 곧 영어 및 다른 언어까지 확장할 예정입니다. 지금은 영어로 Content, Company, Email, Country, Product, Expense, Income, Amount 항목을 지원하고 있으니, 곧 더 많은 언어와 데이터 지원을 기대해 주세요!


Fill Up과 함께 데이터 채우기는 이제 더 이상 귀찮은 일이 아닙니다.



The Fill Up plugin has officially launched!


Now, you don’t need to worry about filling virtual data in lists, card UIs, data grids, and more. With just one click, Fill Up randomly populates your designs with data, making your workflow smarter and more efficient. Leave the complicated data entry to us, so you can focus on what you do best: design!


We’re currently prioritizing Korean text conversion, but we’re working hard to expand support to English and other languages soon. For now, Fill Up supports the following English fields: Content, Company, Email, Country, Product, Expense, Income, and Amount. Stay tuned for more languages and data support!


With Fill Up, data filling is no longer a hassle—it’s a breeze!
plugins.tagline: A plugin that automatically fills in content.

현재는 한국어 텍스트 변환 기능에 우선 집중하고 있지만, 곧 영어 및 다른 언어까지 확장할 예정입니다. 지금은 영어로 Content, Company, Email, Country, Product, Expense, Income, Amount 항목을 지원하고 있으니, 곧 더 많은 언어와 데이터 지원을 기대해 주세요!


Fill Up과 함께 데이터 채우기는 이제 더 이상 귀찮은 일이 아닙니다.



The Fill Up plugin has officially launched!


Now, you don’t need to worry about filling virtual data in lists, card UIs, data grids, and more. With just one click, Fill Up randomly populates your designs with data, making your workflow smarter and more efficient. Leave the complicated data entry to us, so you can focus on what you do best: design!


We’re currently prioritizing Korean text conversion, but we’re working hard to expand support to English and other languages soon. For now, Fill Up supports the following English fields: Content, Company, Email, Country, Product, Expense, Income, and Amount. Stay tuned for more languages and data support!


With Fill Up, data filling is no longer a hassle—it’s a breeze!
100585.release_notes:
• Apply gap input disable with a motion to fade out.
• Add an “all” label to the overall checkbox feature.
• Set the content to be disabled by default.
100585.tagline: A plugin that automatically fills in content.

plugins.name: figma-lokalise-unofficial-plugin
plugins.description:
Unofficial Lokalise Plugin.


Enhance Your Design Workflow with Our Figma Plugin for Lokalise


Our plugin bridges the gap between Figma and Lokalise, offering a seamless integration that streamlines your design localization process. With this tool at your disposal, you can:


Link Texts Between Figma and Lokalise: Easily connect text elements from your Figma designs with corresponding texts in Lokalise, ensuring consistency and accuracy across your project.


Update All Texts with One Click: Synchronize all your design texts with Lokalise in just one click. This feature ensures that all your text elements in Figma are up-to-date with the latest translations and content changes.


Switch Texts to Different Languages Instantly: Our plugin allows you to effortlessly change the language of text elements in your Figma designs. This capability is perfect for quickly adapting your designs to various language markets.


Set Individual Text Elements: Gain the flexibility to specify translations for each text element within Figma individually. This feature provides the precision needed for customizing specific parts of your design to suit different linguistic contexts.


Full demo here: https://youtu.be/VPveQklO4OE


Support me at Patreon ❤️
plugins.tagline: Bridging Design and Localization in One Click

plugins.name: Bulletproof Icons
plugins.description:
🎯 Bulletproof icons


A simple figma plugin to quickly create what I call "Bulletproof" icons for your icon libraries.


Tired of readjusting your icon component layers, so that they don't break in your design? Using different icon from different icon libraries? This plugin will solve the problem of creating consistent icon components.


What does it do?

This plugin will make layer structure for all of your icon like this:


Frame/

├── Union

│ ├──Vector

├── Original


So, when you change color of your icon, resize it or do any other modification, and then change the icon component to another one your modifications won't reset or break. They will be consistent no matter what you do.


How to use?

It's so simple! There's no UI, just select one or multiple frames (not vectors) and run the plugin.

accepted.name: Əlisa Musayev
accepted.description:
Instagram: zoomxrist
Telegram: zoomxrist
mail: alisamusa.ms@gmail.com

plugins.tagline: Create consistent, scalable icons that maintain their quality across different sizes and use cases.

Tired of readjusting your icon component layers, so that they don't break in your design? Using different icon from different icon libraries? This plugin will solve the problem of creating consistent icon components.


What does it do?

So, when you change color of your icon, resize it or do any other modification, and then change the icon component to another one your modifications won't reset or break. They will be consistent no matter what you do.

124188.release_notes:
Fixes:
- Fixed bug when applying plugin on icon with no stroke. Before it was adding stroke to them and then applying "outline-stoke" which resulted in unexpected results.

Features:
- Plugin now creates copy of original icon instead of working on original file.  Before it was keeping original as hidden layer in the result frame.
- Icon component with prefix icn/ is now created when applying the plugin.
124188.tagline: Create consistent, scalable icons that maintain their quality across different sizes and use cases.

plugins.name: Hilbert
plugins.description:
Weave unique patterns with FASS curves.


FASS stands for 'space-Filling, self-Avoiding, Simple, and Self-similar curves' and they allow you to generate intricate patterns that are made with a single line. https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Space-filling_curve


How to use:


1) Select an object on your document and press "Pick".


->Your object will then be displayed as a clipping mask to help you preview the result.


2) Play.


3) Press "Place" to apply your artwork to the selected object.


-> The artwork will be clipped inside the object's geometry.


4) Select another object and press "Pick" to apply it as a the new clipping mask.


NOTE: For performance reasons this version is limited to a maximum of 5 iterations.


----------------------------------------------------------------

Want to support the development of free features and plugins?

You can buy me a coffee!

accepted.name: Eduardo Barbosa
accepted.description: Creative Technologist. I build tools and systems that enhance quality of life, unlock new possibilities, and empower teams and individuals.

plugins.tagline: Discover the creative potential of space-filling curves in Figma.

96381.description:

plugins.name: wip!
plugins.description:
This plugin allows you to add or remove a red semi-transparent overlay to selected frames in Figma. It is designed to visually mark work-in-progress (WIP) elements directly within the design interface.


How to use

  1. Select one or multiple elements. Currently supporting: Frames, Auto-Layout Frames and Text.
  2. Run the plugin.
  3. When a frame is selected, the plugin checks for an existing overlay named 'wip'. If found, it removes the overlay; if not, it creates a new rectangle with a red semi-transparent fill and positions it to cover the entire frame. When a text is selected plugin adds a red semi-transparent fill with the same logic.
  4. To delete the overlay or fill run the plugin again.


This plugin supports frames with Auto Layout, adjusting the overlay accordingly.


You can expect a straightforward way to highlight and manage WIP items in their Figma designs, with limitations around specific node type support.


Add the plugin to Keyboard Shortcuts:

  1. Settings -> Keyboard -> Keyboard Shortcuts... -> App Shortcuts
  2. Press [+] button and choose "Figma".
  3. Write the plugin name "wip!" in menu title. Add shortcut combination. I personally use control + option + w.
plugins.tagline: Show that the selected frames or copy are not yet ready and you're still working on them

93387.release_notes: The latest update adds automatic constraints to the "Work in Progress" overlay, ensuring it remains perfectly aligned to all sides of the parent frame even when resized.
93387.tagline: Show that the selected frames or copy are not yet ready and you're still working on them

plugins.name: Nalipka
plugins.description:
Nalipka is a simple and playful plugin designed to quickly turn any element into a sticker.

Perfect for brainstorms, workshops, notes, visual highlights — or just for fun.


How it works:


  1. Select one or more elements
  2. Open the Nalipka plugin
  3. Click the Create Sticker button
  4. The selected elements will:
  5. Get a white stroke
  6. Soft shadow
  7. 2px rounded corners
  8. Text will be auto-flattened to vector


Key features:


✦ Supports multiple selected objects


✦ Automatically converts text to vector


✦ Preserves original position


✦ Adds white stroke, shadow, and rounded corners — like a real sticker


✦ Clean and minimal UI
plugins.tagline: Make anything look like a sticker. Select → Click → Done.

Easy and fast conversion. Free for you.

plugins.name: Darker
plugins.description:
Tired of manually creating dark mode versions of your designs? Darker makes it super easy! Just click once and watch your light design transform into a beautiful dark theme. Perfect for new designers who want to create professional dark modes without the headache.


What it does:

  1. Converts colors smartly - no more guessing what looks good in dark mode
  2. Works with everything - from simple shapes to complex designs
  3. Keeps your design system intact - whether you use Variables or Styles
  4. Has a handy reset button if you want to start over
  5. uper simple to use - literally just one click!


Start creating dark themes in seconds, not hours. Darker handles the complex stuff so you can focus on designing.

accepted.name: Panamparan Arasu T.K

plugins.description:
Easily export your Figma components into a structured Excel file (.xlsx) with just one click! This plugin scans your Figma file, extracts published components, and organises them into an easy-to-navigate spreadsheet—perfect for design system documentation and collaboration.


Key Features:

✅ Detects published components from each page

✅ Exports to Excel (.xlsx) for easy reference

✅ Captures Component Name, Page, Status,, Icon

✅ Helps teams track and manage design components effortlessly


Keep your design system structured and accessible—export your components today! 🚀


Note: This is my first plugin as I was testing around on making one. I plan on including a feature to export to notion database as well. Please let me know if anything would be great for this.

plugins.name: IcoSun
plugins.description:
What is Icosun?

Icosun is an open sourced replacement for Icomoon. Its a tool that allows you to convert SVG icons into web fonts. It ensures icons are scalable, accessible, and efficient for web and app development


What does the plugin export?

  1. Source SVGs - A folder containing all raw SVGs used to generate the font files. Ideal for mobile tech stacks that don't support font files as an icon input.
  2. JSON Unicode Map - A key-value mapping between icon names and the unicode values, making it easy to reference icons in your code.
  3. TypeScript Unicode Map - A TypeScript constant that maps SVGs to their unicode representations, allowing direct usage in TypeScript projects.
  4. Combined SVG - A merged single SVG file that links path data to the unicode values, providing a visual reference for your font set.
  5. Font Files - IcoSun generates all major font file formats, ensuring compatibility across different platforms. It outputs TTF, EOT, OTF, WOFF and WOFF2.


What makes IcoSun different?

  1. Duplicate Prevention - IcoSun detects duplicate icons and warns you before export, reducing manual errors in large icon sets.
  2. Simulate Output - SVG-to-font conversion often faces path-winding issues, leading to incorrect subtractions. With IcoSun, you can preview the final output inside Figma before exporting, minimizing unexpected rendering issues.


IcoSun is fully open source, feel free to make changes to the logic as you like 😀
plugins.tagline: Generet font file for your icon library

124671.name: IcoSun
124671.description:

  2. JSON Unicode Map - A key-value mapping between icon names and the unicode values, making it easy to reference icons in your code.
  3. TypeScript Unicode Map - A TypeScript constant that maps SVGs to their unicode representations, allowing direct usage in TypeScript projects.
  4. Combined SVG - A merged single SVG file that links path data to the unicode values, providing a visual reference for your font set.
  5. Font Files - IcoSun generates all major font file formats, ensuring compatibility across different platforms. It outputs TTF, EOT, OTF, WOFF and WOFF2.


What makes IcoSun different?

124671.tagline: Generet font file for your icon library

plugins.name: Version Stack
plugins.description:
Version Stack allows you to create and manage multiple versions of selected frames in Figma with ease. Each version is automatically saved with a timestamp and arranged in a dedicated “Version Stack” page using an auto-layout for seamless tracking. Forget manual duplication—this plugin ensures that your design iterations are neatly organized and easily accessible.


How to Use:


1.Select a frame you want to save as a version.

2.Run the plugin, and click 'Save Version' . A new version with a timestamp will be saved in the “Version Stack” page.

3.Each version is stacked vertically in an auto-layout, allowing you to track the evolution of your design effortlessly.


Important Note:

The frame name must remain the same for new versions to be added to the existing version stack.


Limitations:


•Works only with Frame nodes.

•Ensure the “Version Stack” page is not renamed manually to avoid issues.


We Value Your Feedback:

We’re constantly looking to improve! If you have any suggestions, feedback, or feature requests, please share them with us. Your input will help make Version Stack even better for you and the design community. Thank you for using our plugin!
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly save and manage design versions in an organized layout

plugins.name: Mercurius - Smart Exporter for WEBP, PNG, and JPG
plugins.description:
🎨 Mercurius - Smart Exporter for WEBP, PNG, and JPG


Mercurius is a Figma plugin that analyzes and exports images in multiple formats (WEBP, PNG, or JPG) with AI-generated descriptions. The plugin uses OpenAI's API to generate accurate descriptions and suggest meaningful file names while automatically optimizing file size.


Quick Export Mode 📦

For when you just need to export images quickly with optimization


  1. Select an image, frame, or component in Figma
  2. Click "Export Image" on the home screen
  3. You'll see: selected frame name, image dimensions, aspect ratio
  4. Configure export settings: choose format (WEBP, PNG, or JPG), set maximum file size in MB, select export scale (1x, 2x, 3x, 5x)
  5. Click "Export" to save your optimized image


AI-Powered Export Mode 🤖

For when you want AI assistance with descriptions and smart file naming


  1. Select an image, frame, or component in Figma
  2. First-time setup: Enter your OpenAI API key: the key will be securely saved for future use
  3. Click "Analyze Image" on the home screen
  4. The AI will analyze and provide: smart image description, SEO-friendly file name suggestion, image dimensions and aspect ratio
  5. Configure export settings: choose format (WEBP, PNG, or JPG), set maximum file size in MB, select export scale (1x, 2x, 3x, 5x)
  6. Click "Export" to save your image with the AI-suggested name



Both modes feature automatic image optimization to meet your file size requirements while maintaining the best possible quality.
plugins.tagline: Smart image analysis and export for WEBP, PNG, or JPG with GPT descriptions and size optimization

125273.name: Mercurius - Smart Exporter for WEBP, PNG, and JPG

plugins.name: Color Mapper
plugins.description:
Effortlessly swap and remap colors in your designs while preserving library styles. Perfect for theme switching, brand updates, and design system management.

Key Features:


Intuitive drag-and-drop color remapping

Smart library style preservation

Batch update multiple elements at once

Support for both direct colors and style swatches

Works with fills and strokes


Simply select elements, drag colors to remap them, and apply changes with a single click. Color Mapper automatically detects and preserves your library styles while making color updates lightning fast.

plugins.name: Defold Handoff
plugins.description:
With this plugin, you can easily manage GUI template designs and atlases, streamlining the resource handoff process for the Defold game engine. It features a robust customization system for GUI nodes, a Slice 9 generator/editor, and various support utilities and export tools.


Atlases:


  1. Create and manage sprite atlases directly within your Figma project.
  2. Bundle or combine atlases for streamlined export.
  3. Export atlases and image resources for your Defold project with a single click.


GUI Nodes:


  1. Design Defold GUI templates as simple frames in Figma.
  2. Fully leverage Figma's design tools without any limitations from Defold's side.
  3. Edit additional GUI node properties using the custom editor.
  4. Export GUI templates as they are, or bundled with atlases and other resources.
  5. Includes additional support utilities for developers.
plugins.tagline: Streamlines Defold's GUI template design handoff process from Figma

127480.name: Defold Handoff
127480.description:
With this plugin, you can easily manage GUI template designs and atlases, streamlining the resource handoff process for the Defold game engine. It features a robust customization system for GUI nodes, a Slice 9 generator/editor, and various support utilities and export tools.


Atlases:


  1. Create and manage sprite atlases directly within your Figma project.
  2. Bundle or combine atlases for streamlined export.
  3. Export atlases and image resources for your Defold project with a single click.


GUI Nodes:


  1. Design Defold GUI templates as simple frames in Figma.
  2. Fully leverage Figma's design tools without any limitations from Defold's side.
  3. Edit additional GUI node properties using the custom editor.
  4. Export GUI templates as they are, or bundled with atlases and other resources.
  5. Includes additional support utilities for developers.
127480.tagline: Streamlines Defold's GUI template design handoff process from Figma

plugins.name: FontLang Switcher
plugins.description:
Transform your Figma designs with ease! This plugin combines three essential features into one convenient tool:


🌐 Translate Text – Instantly translate your design’s text content into various languages. Ideal for multilingual design projects.


🔤 Replace Fonts – Quickly swap fonts across your designs, making global typography updates a breeze.


🔄 Mirror Elements – Flip or mirror design elements horizontally for right-to-left (RTL) support or layout variations.


Why you’ll love this plugin:

✅ Save time on manual updates

✅ Enhance global design workflows

✅ Streamline font management and layout adjustments

Perfect for designers working on international products, multilingual interfaces, and adaptable layouts.
plugins.tagline: Seamless Text Translation, Font Replacement & Mirroring – All in One Plugin

136554.description:

plugins.name: Thumb Zone AI
plugins.description:
The Thumb Zone plugin enables you to add your frames to the platform and test it with your users. This plugin can be used for mobile UIs and allows you to perform various types of tests such as UI audit, predicting user behavior, conducting tests with synthetic users, as well as testing with real users to study their emotions.


To add a file from Thumb Zone to Figma, follow the steps below:


  1. Install the plugin.
  2. Define a new product in Thumb Zone.
  3. Select the "Import from Figma" option in Thumb Zone.
  4. Generate a token.
  5. Enter the received token in the Figma plugin.
  6. Select the frames.
  7. Sync!


Frames are synced to Thumb Zone screens, build and test your flow!


Visit https://thumbzone.ai to create your account.

accepted.name: Thumb Zone
accepted.description: AI copilot for mobile user testing

plugins.tagline: Emotion AI for Product Experience

plugins.name: Frame Name to Text
plugins.description:
Do you find it frustrating when exporting a flow and frame names don’t appear? With Frame to Text, you can easily convert frame names into editable text layers with just one click!


This plugin can help you:


Convert frame names into editable text layers.

Automatically update text layers by running the plugin again after changing frame names.

Enhance your design workflow and ensure your exports are clear and informative!
plugins.tagline: Easily Convert and Update Frame Names to Text!
